safetyAdvice.advice: It is unsafe to consume alcohol with Paracetamol.
Paracetamol is safe to use during pregnancy. Most studies have shown low or no risk to the developing baby.
Paracetamol is safe to use during breastfeeding. Human studies suggest that the drug does not pass into the breastmilk in a significant amount and is not harmful to the baby.
Paracetamol does not usually affect your ability to drive.

Paracetamol should be used with caution in patients with kidney disease. Dose adjustment of Paracetamol may be needed. Please consult your doctor. However, Paracetamol is considered the safest painkiller for kidney disease patients.

Paracetamol should be used with caution in patients with liver disease. Dose adjustment of Paracetamol may be needed. Please consult your doctor. However, the use of Paracetamol is not recommended in patients with severe liver disease and active liver disease.
It is unsafe to consume alcohol with Ibuprofen.
Ibuprofen is safe to use during pregnancy only if prescribed. Consult your doctor.
Ibuprofen is safe to use during breastfeeding. Consult your doctor.
Ibuprofen does not usually affect your ability to drive.
Ibuprofen should be used with caution in patients with kidney disease. Dose adjustment of Ibuprofen may be needed. Please consult your doctor.
Ibuprofen should be used with caution in patients with liver disease. Dose adjustment of Ibuprofen may be needed. Please consult your doctor.
Amoxicillin is safe to use during pregnancy. Consult your doctor.
Amoxicillin is safe to use during breastfeeding. Human studies suggest that the drug does not pass into the breastmilk in a significant amount and is not harmful to the baby.
Amoxicillin does not usually affect your ability to drive.
Complete the full course as prescribed. Inform your doctor if you have a history of allergic reactions to penicillins.
It is unsafe to consume alcohol with Cetirizine.
Cetirizine is safe to use during pregnancy. Consult your doctor.
Cetirizine is safe to use during breastfeeding. Consult your doctor.
May cause drowsiness. Avoid driving or operating machinery until you know how this medication affects you.
Metformin is safe to use during pregnancy. Consult your doctor.
Metformin is safe to use during breastfeeding. Consult your doctor.
Metformin does not usually affect your ability to drive.
Monitor blood sugar levels regularly. Take with meals to reduce gastrointestinal discomfort.
Omeprazole is safe to use during pregnancy. Consult your doctor.
Omeprazole is safe to use during breastfeeding. Consult your doctor.
Omeprazole does not usually affect your ability to drive.
Take at least 30 minutes before a meal. Consult your doctor if you need to take it for more than 14 days.
Azithromycin is safe to use during pregnancy. Consult your doctor.
Azithromycin is safe to use during breastfeeding. Consult your doctor.
Azithromycin does not usually affect your ability to drive.
Complete the full course as prescribed. Consult your doctor if you have any allergic reactions to antibiotics.
Salbutamol is safe to use during pregnancy. Consult your doctor.
Salbutamol is safe to use during breastfeeding. Consult your doctor.
Salbutamol does not usually affect your ability to drive.
Follow your doctor's instructions on usage. Inform your doctor if you experience any side effects.
Hydrocortisone is safe to use during pregnancy. Consult your doctor.
Hydrocortisone is safe to use during breastfeeding. Consult your doctor.
Hydrocortisone does not usually affect your ability to drive.
Use as directed by your doctor. Do not apply to broken or infected skin.
Dextromethorphan is safe to use during pregnancy. Consult your doctor.
Dextromethorphan is safe to use during breastfeeding. Consult your doctor.
Dextromethorphan does not usually affect your ability to drive.
Follow your doctor's instructions on dosage. Do not exceed the recommended dose.
Vitamin D is safe to use during pregnancy. Consult your doctor.
Vitamin D is safe to use during breastfeeding. Consult your doctor.
Vitamin D does not usually affect your ability to drive.
Follow your doctor's instructions on dosage. Monitor your blood levels as advised.
